meanings.def: used after a verb or preposition to mean ‘in, at or to this position or place’
examples: I live here.
Put the box here.
Click here for more details.
Let's get out of here.
Come over here.
I can't hear you—the signal is very bad.
We don't need to move—we can see it all from here!

meanings.def: used when you are giving or showing something to somebody
examples: Here's the money I promised you.
Here's a dish that is simple and quick to make.
Here is your opportunity.
Here comes the bus.
I can't find my keys. Oh, here they are.
Here we are (= we've arrived).

meanings.def: used to show your role in a situation
examples: I'm here to help you.
The countdown to Christmas starts here.
Here the speaker paused to have a drink.
Come by here now!

meanings.def: the present time; at the present time
examples: our obsession with the here and now
We're going to settle this here and now.
Papers were scattered here and there on the floor.

meanings.def: used when you are telling people that you are just going to do something exciting, dangerous, etc.
examples: ‘Here goes,’ said Grace and took a deep breath.

meanings.def: used to wish somebody health or success, as you lift a glass and drink a toast
examples: Here's to your future happiness!

meanings.def: in many different places; all around
said when something is starting to happen
examples: ‘Here we go,’ thought Fred, ‘she's sure to say something.’

meanings.def: said when something is starting to happen again, especially something bad
used when you are giving something to somebody
examples: Here you are. This is what you were asking for.

meanings.def: used when you are giving something to somebody
examples: Here you go. Four copies, is that right?
What might have happened is neither here nor there.
As soon as I get my money I'm out of here!
Come by here now!
